comments:

Java 1.4.2_03. At the startup of 3.0M6 I get the message that there has been 
errors and to check the log file. Here is the info from that file:

Haven't you deleted a plugin manually?

I have not deleted any plug-ins that I am aware of. If you are sayinig this is 
the case, then what do I need to do to resolve it?
Did you unzipped M6 on top of M5?

At this point I can't remember whether I unzipped into a new folder or over 
M5. Whould the problem be caused by unzipping over M5 or not unzipping over 
M5? In either case, how do I now which plug-ins I am missing?

The problem is that many things have changed/moved etc in Eclipse and unzipping 
M6 over M5 will leave various bits and pieces that are invalid or confusing for 
M6.  Eclipse is not designed for this use model.

To clear things up, you should be able to delete the .config dir in your 
Eclipse install directory.  Could you try that and see if it clears things up?

Note, there is an actual bug in this space and we are working on it but the 
above should allow you to continue working.

If deleting the .config fixes your problem then this is a duplicate of the 
problem we are working on (not sure of the bug number right now).  Let us know 
either way.

Even after deleting the .config file, the errors are still occuring. Do you 
want me to send the latest from my log file? 

Also, for some reason now my right click menus won't come up....ugh.

Dave

We would be interested by getting the log.

As an extra test, would you mind trying to install eclipse in a different 
folder than usual and start it with a new workspace and tell us what's going on?

Thank you

I am having the same problems under Mac OS X 10.3.2 running:

java.version=1.4.1_01
java.vendor=Apple Computer, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=ppc, WS=carbon, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os macosx -ws carbon -arch ppc -showlocation

M6 was created in a brand new directory. The only things I've done to it were to
install p4eclipse via Software Update, and to install the Oxygen XML plugin in
my plugins.

I get the error on launch if I had an OxygenXML document open at quit. I also
get the error 8 times the first time I use OxygenXML. In addition my right
clicks stop working at times.

After additional research, I found special installation instructions for the
OxygenXML plugin (which is what seemed related to my problem). Applying the
changes provided below (and blowing away .config) solved my problems.

From the OxygenXML site:

For Eclipse 3.0 M6 you have to copy the xercesImpl.jar and xml-apis.jar files
from the lib directory of the plugin into the endorsed directory that Eclipse is
using. To find out the exact location of this directory you have to open the
Help/About/Configuration Details report, then look for the value of
java.endorsed.dirs key. If the listed directory does not exist on the disk, you
have to create it.

David, there have been several changes put in for null pointer/registry 
issues.  Can you confirm that your problem is fixed using I0121?  We are unable 
to reproduce so cannot test ourselves.

After upgrading to the Oxygen M6 experimental plug-in and following the 
direction on the Oxygen site, all errors ceased on my 3.0M6 version. It 
appears that it was probably the Oxygen plug-in that was causing me the errors.

Both people reporting problems seem to be happy now.  Appears it was an Oxygen 
problem.
